page.title: 01Tean and District
page.content: The area is 10 miles S.E. of Stoke-on- Trent. Upper Tean (pop approx. 2000) is the largest village. Freehay amd Winnothdale are smaller areas of population. On the edge of the Staffordshire Moorlands it is a rural area of Dairy farming with small holdings in Winnothdale. Some farmers also keep sheep. The Tape Mill in Tean provides employment for many. Most men have to travel out of the area for work. There are 3 (1 disused) gravel pits and some small lorry firms for transporting the gravel. Tean is a small village centred since about 1730 around the Mill, but in the last 20 years there has been considerable housing developments on the outskirts, doubling the population. The A50 Trunk Road has recently been diverted away from Tean bringing Traffic reliefo
